newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel warns of crisis if EMU fails - sources.
newsitem.headline: Waigel warns of crisis if EMU fails - sources.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel warned a meeting of his Christian Social Union that a failure of European monetary union (EMU) could plunge Germany into economic crisis, party sources said.
Waigel said a failure of EMU, due to begin in January 1999, would threaten Germany with an economic crisis and currency-market chaos, the sources said.

At the February 8 meeting of finance ministers from the Group of Seven industrialised nations in Berlin, Waigel plans to discuss the state of the world economy and a debt initiative for the world's poorest nations, they said.

Domestically, he also aims to reform Germany's basic budgetary laws to increase flexibility and transparency, and circulated models of such budgetary reform at the party meeting on Wednesday, the sources said.
